item.title: SPC - No watches are valid as of Mon Feb 20 14:41:01 UTC 2023
item.description: No watches are valid as of Mon Feb 20 14:41:01 UTC 2023.

item.title: SPC - No MDs are in effect as of Mon Feb 20 14:41:01 UTC 2023
item.description: No Mesoscale Discussions are in effect as of Mon Feb 20 14:41:01 UTC 2023.

item.title: SPC Feb 20, 2023 1300 UTC Day 1 Convective Outlook
item.description:
SPC 1300Z Day 1 Outlook 
 Day 1 Convective Outlook NWS Storm Prediction Center Norman OK 0624 AM CST Mon Feb 20 2023 Valid 201300Z - 211200Z ...NO SEVERE THUNDERSTORM AREAS FORECAST... ...SUMMARY... Severe thunderstorms are not expected through early Tuesday. ...Portions of the southern Appalachians to the Lower MS Valley... A few elevated thunderstorms will be possible, mainly in the late evening to overnight, across parts of the Cumberland Plateau and TN Valley. Modest low-level warm theta-e advection, peripherally attendant to a clipper shortwave trough progressing into the Great Lakes should support at least isolated showers. Predominately westerly low-level winds suggest MUCAPE will likely remain no greater than scant, yielding only very isolated thunderstorm potential. Farther west-southwest into the Lower MS Valley, while modest low-level warm advection is also anticipated tonight, relatively warm/dry mid-levels may mitigate appreciable thunderstorm development, resulting in unconditional probabilities around 10 percent or less. ..Grams/Gleason.. 02/20/2023
Read more
